column4: Remove unfinished openid4j from the tag

Login/Logout: Enable pluggable Subject state binding
Login/Logout: Enable pluggable Subject state binding
Updated log message to be a little more readable.
Finally!  Able to remove direct call to ThreadContext as Thread state management is no longer directly coupled to Subject implementations.
Made session mode resolution more explicit - it will guarantee the default ServletContainerSessionManager in all case except when the native one is explicitly configured.
Login/Logout: Enable pluggable Subject state binding
Create a simple command line utility to hash passwords
DomainPermission does not fully support domain  actions and targets properties

Altered logic to allow the redirect url to be based on the current request or subject (before logout)  falling back to a static url if necessary.  Subclasses can override the template method to perform request-specific redirect URL acquisition.

Added an intermediate getRedirectUrl(request response) method to allow subclasses to dynamically configure the redirectUrl if desired.  Default implementation returns getRedirectUrl() to retain current behavior.
DefaultHasher does not generate random salt
Update root pom to ignore maven life cycles in eclipse (m2e 0.13)
Initialize Shiro using a <listener> in web.xml
Would like to be able to put shiro.ini in the WEB-INF directory with other web configuration files.

Create a PasswordService to automate user password management techniques
added experimental principal feature (PrincipalMap  SimplePrincipalMap).  Not used anywhere in code yet.

Updated sample Spring application to use the correct Spring libraries.  Now deploys successfully  although Spring remoting is failing for the Swing app.

Updated trunk to reflect version 1.2.0-SNAPSHOT to reflect forward-incompatible changes and new features.  Any point release (1.1.x) bug fixes will be done in the branches/shiro-root-1.1.x branch and merged into the trunk.

Extracted cache API to its own Maven module.  No package names or public APIs have changed.

Removing OSGI bundle packaging type in some poms - they're causing classes from other modules to be included in the resulting .jar.  We need to better analyze how to support OSGi effectively and then update the poms accordingly.
Moved config-related tests to the config module(s)
Added config modules to the shiro-all .jar

Moved configuration-related code to a new module.  This decouples configuration issues from Shiro's core API since config is largely environment specific (Ini  Tapestry  Spring  Guice  etc).  This also (finally) removes shiro-core's dependency on Apache Commons BeanUtils.
